com.beaglebuddy.id3.v23.frame_body

Class ID3v23FrameBodyPopularimeter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.beaglebuddy.util.Utility
      • com.beaglebuddy.id3.v23.frame_body.ID3v23FrameBodyUtility
        • com.beaglebuddy.id3.v23.frame_body.ID3v23FrameBody
          • com.beaglebuddy.id3.v23.frame_body.ID3v23FrameBodyPopularimeter

  • public class ID3v23FrameBodyPopularimeter
extends ID3v23FrameBody

    A popularimeter frame body is associated with an ID3v2.3 POPM frame which is used to specify how much you like an .mp3 song. The popularimeter frame body contains the following fields:

    Popularimeter Frame Body Fields
     FieldDescription
    1. userEmailuser's e-mail address
    2. rating rating of the .mp3 song from 1 - 255, where 1 is the worst and 255 is best. 0 is unknown, ie, not yet rated.
    3. counter number of times the .mp3 song has been played. this field is optional.

    There may be more than one popularimeter frame in each tag, but only one with the same e-mail address.

    See Also:
    ID3v23Frame, ID3v23FrameBodyPlayCounter, ID3 tag version 2.3.0 standard, wikipedia history of ID3 tags

    • Constructor Detail

      • ID3v23FrameBodyPopularimeter

        public ID3v23FrameBodyPopularimeter()
        The default constructor is called when creating a new frame. The default values used are:
        • empty user e-maill address
        • not yet rated
        • 0 times played

      • ID3v23FrameBodyPopularimeter

        public ID3v23FrameBodyPopularimeter(java.lang.String userEmail,
                                    int rating,
                                    int counter)
        This constructor is called when creating a new frame.
        Parameters:
        userEmail - user's e-mail.
        rating - [1-255] where 1 = worst and 255 = best. 0 is unknown, ie, not yet rated.
        counter - number of times the song has been played (optional).

      • ID3v23FrameBodyPopularimeter

        public ID3v23FrameBodyPopularimeter(java.io.InputStream inputStream,
                                    int frameBodySize)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        This constructor is called when reading in an existing frame from an .mp3 file. This is then followed by a call to the parse() method.
        Parameters:
        inputStream - input stream pointing to a popularimeter frame body in the .mp3 file.
        frameBodySize - size (in bytes) of the frame's body.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is an error while reading the frame body.

      • setBuffer

        public void setBuffer()
        If the frame body's values have been modified, then resize the raw binary buffer and store the new values there. When finished, the dirty flag is reset to indicate that the buffer is up to date, and the frame is now ready to be saved to the .mp3 file.
        Overrides:
        setBuffer in class ID3v23FrameBody

        public java.lang.String toString()
        gets a string representation of the popularimeter frame body showing all of the frame's fields and their values.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a string representation of the frame body.
